byline.contributor: Annie Correal, Sandra E. Garcia and Nate Schweber contributed reporting, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER, ASHLEY SOUTHALL and AL BAKER

abstract: Witnesses to murder of Julian Washington of South Bronx in April describe fight at party that got out of hand; Washington was stabbed after partygoers were unable to restrict flailing movements of Vernon Hubbard, who was wielding knives while very intoxicated (Series: Murder in the 4-0).

headline.print_headline: Social Circles Collide on the Dance Floor. Then, a Deadly Brawl.
headline.main: Social Circles Collide on a Dance Floor. Then a Brawl Ends in Death.

snippet: Holding a steak knife in each hand, a guest announced: “Nobody’s getting out of here alive.” A chaotic party turned deadly for Julian Washington in a Bronx precinct where The Times is covering every murder....
lead_paragraph: Holding a steak knife in each hand, a guest announced: “Nobody’s getting out of here alive.” A chaotic party turned deadly for Julian Washington in a Bronx precinct where The Times is covering every murder.
